title: riparazione file posta
content: Buongiorno, ho riscontrato la mancanza di alcune mail nell'account di posta in entrata (configurata come pop). Ho fatto la riparazione della posta in arrivo e i messaggi mancanti sono comparsi e sono perfettamente leggibili, tuttavia se cambio cartella e passo dalla posta in arrivo alla posta inviata e poi torno alla posta in arrivo, i messaggi recuperati con la riparazione scompaiono. Rifacendo nuovamente la riparazione, compaiono nuovamente nella posta in arrivo. Ho provato a fare la compattazione prima e dopo la riparazione ma il problema non si risolve. Avete qualche idea per risolvere il problema? Grazie mille per la vostra disponibilità. Vinicio

title: Codice di errore: PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR
content:
Salve Ho un desktop, AMD A10-7800 Radeon R7, 12 Compute Cores 4C+8G 3.50 GHz, SO Windows 10 Home 64Bit ver. 22H2 19045.2006, come antivirus uso Kaspersky internet Security. Dopo l'aggionamento di win10 home, dalla versione d 21H alla 22H... non mi funziona più Thunderbird, non riesco più ne a mandare email e nemmeno a riceverle. Se mando un email mi da questo errore: [Invio del messaggio non riuscito. Non è stato possibile inviare il messaggio perché la connessione al server di posta in uscita (SMTP) out.virgilio.it è scaduta. Riprova.] Non ricevo email e questo è l'errore: (Codice di errore: PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR)

Ho provato ha reinstallare per due volte Thunderbird ma succede sempre la stessa cosa.

Potete aiutarmi? Grazie

title: timeout after END-OF-MESSAGE after upgrade to supernova
content:

In server the log says Aug 31 11:43:21 imap postfix/smtpd[32585]: connect from unknown[83.149.170.235] Aug 31 11:43:21 imap postfix/smtpd[32585]: B62C01007AD: client=unknown[83.149.170.235], sasl_method=PLAIN, sasl_username=r.xxx@tosnet.net Aug 31 11:43:21 imap postfix/cleanup[27232]: B62C01007AD: message-id=<b4f357e5-4fa4-4edc-a735-7191653d1e0b@tosnet.it> Aug 31 11:43:22 imap postfix/qmgr[24150]: B62C01007AD: from=<r.xxx@tosnet.it>, size=79993, nrcpt=1 (queue active) Aug 31 11:43:23 imap postfix/smtp[7294]: B62C01007AD: to=<xxx@gmail.com>, relay=gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com[74.125.128.27]:25, delay=2.2, delays=0.45/0.01/0.45/1.3, dsn=2.0.0, status=sent (250 2.0.0 OK 1693475003 si28-20020a170906cedc00b00984f07f9bc1si686277ejb.395 - gsmtp) Aug 31 11:43:23 imap postfix/qmgr[24150]: B62C01007AD: removed

Aug 31 11:44:07 imap postfix/smtpd[32585]: timeout after END-OF-MESSAGE from unknown[83.149.170.235] Aug 31 11:44:07 imap postfix/smtpd[32585]: disconnect from unknown[83.149.170.235] ehlo=1 auth=1 mail=1 rcpt=1 data=1 commands=5

title: Thunderbird not able to connect to mail server
content:
Scenario: A new mail user account (mailbox) on mail server. Webmail is able to use the new account. My phone (Huawei) is able to connect with SSL/TLS instantly.

But Thunderbird moans/whines/complains persistently that "receiving mail server already exists". (That's a quick & dirty translation of the actual error message in Finnish "Saapuvan postin palvelin on jo olemassa". ) TB connects perfectly to many other older accounts on the same server.

The problem appeared originally after I deleted one mail box on TB and later attempted to activate it again. After that my Thunderbird has been somehow confused. All old mail account work as expected, but connecting to new mail accounts fail persistently. Annoying and weard.

title: I can't SEND emails, I can receive them.
content:
Using Thunderbird. Since last night I can't send emails. It keeps telling me "connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.atlanticbb.net timed out. Try again." I tried sending just a small one word message saying test, and it goes through. But if I try to write an email, reply or forward I get that message. It makes no sense to me. I called my ISP and they tell me they aren't having any email issues, that it has to be Thunderbird. But why can I receive but not send? I can send and receive them on my galaxy phone.

I can receive them with no problem. I have the IMAP set correctly. It's been working super the last few months, and now this. Anyone have any suggestions on how to fix it? I don't want to use my servers email program, it just doesn't have the features I want. They told me to delete my account and re-add it, is that even possible? I'm getting very frustrated. The last time I had to reinstall Thunderbird I had all kinds of issues and lost a lot of my stuff. TIA
creator: lynxstch

title: Updated Thunderbird will not send or receive emails.
content: Thunderbird 115.2.0 was installed on my computer yesterday. Now I can't send or receive email messages. When I try to download my messages, the line at the bottom of the screen says, "Host contacted, sending login information..." This stays visible for quite some time, then finally goes blank. No messages are downloaded. When I try to send a message, the program tries for quite a while, then says, Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.gmail.com timed out. Try again. Needless to say, I have tried again and again, but nothing changes. This has got to be because of the update. None of my settings are any different from what they were two days ago when everything worked. As noted above, my server is gmail. Please help.
creator: CarolynHoglin

title: Local folders deleted messages don't end up in Trash - Default local trash folder misidentified
content:
I have a number of folders and sub folders created in Local Folders. Some of those were used as a means of moving email content from one imap server to another. They include the usual inbox, drafts, sent, junk, trash.

Structure includes 4 or 5 of such layouts.

The problem, when I delete anything from a subfolder directly under Local folders, it does not end up in the Trash folder under Local folders, but rather in one of the trash folders of the above structure.

https://i.imgur.com/cIr1bJY.png

In this pic, items deleted from say pcpartspicker folder would end up in the yellow ttrash folder instead of the red Trash.

Mind you, ttrash was previously called trash. It took me hours to narrow down what was happening until I realized somehow thunderbird was using one of trash folders multiple layers deep as its default local folders trash. The issue was fixed/worked around by renaming the sub trash folders to ttrash, so there was only one "Trash" folder under Local folders.

This begs the question, how does one set the default local folders trash folder? With imap it's a configurable option, but I couldn't find anything for local folders.

Should trash be considered a forbidden folder name?
creator: das1996

title: Impossibile autenticarsi sul server - IMAP GMAIL
content: Ho disintallato thunderbird dopo che ha iniziato a non scaricare più la posta dal server POP3 di Gmail. Ho eliminato anche le cartelle con i profili. Dopo aver installato nuovamente il programma volevo collegare l'account Gmail ma utilizzando IMAP. Nella schermata di creazione account inserisco tutti i dati, nome e cognome, indirizzo email e password (sia quella di Gmail che quella generata tramite "password per le app di google"). In entrambi i casi in automatico mi trova la configurazione IMAP (che ho verificato ed è come quella indicata da google) ma quando confermo ricevo sempre lo stesso errore (Impossibile autenticarsi sul server. La configurazione, il nome utente o la password potrebbero essere errati.) e l'icona di un dinosauro con una spina staccata (non c'è connessione?). Ho provato anche inserendo manualmente la configurazione. Grazie.

title: URL in Thunderbird HTML signature turns and stays purple.
content: I created an HTML signature for one of my Thunderbird email accounts. It has my name, photo and a link to my Website. This was done as a new TB message and saved as an HTML file. It worked just fine on a couple of outgoing emails, but to see how it looked at the receiving end I sent it to myself on another TB account. Going to that account's Inbox and opening the email, the signature looked great, but to test the link I clicked on the Web address. It took me to my Website and, of course, the link in the email turned from blue to purple, as one would expect it to do. Trouble is, when I repeated the test, the second receipt had the URL link purple already. And, just looking at the HTML file the signature points to using Firefox, it's purple there too! So how did the signature file get changed, how do I fix this? I've unchecked the TB setup box that says 'remember sites I've visited,' thinking that might be the cause, but the URL is still purple. Thanks for any tips.
creator: Electrojim

content:

title: Thunderbird Win10 to Win10 migrations for local mail using 102.15.0 (up to date)
content: Migrating TB on Win10 to Win10. Downloaded install program to match my up to date version on the original computer (102.15.0 (64bit) which reports it is up to date (on release update channel). Local mail of 15+ years. Large collection. Copied contents from the two profile folders into the new ones created on the install (one with times.json, the other all my local mail plus). Searched site for matching version (102.15.0) to install. Copied contents of orig profile files to the files created in app data on new computer. Both using Win10. Started over several times, using restore, deleting app data and/or reinstalling windows. Made different copies of App Data. The address books, calendar, tasks, came thorough. But there is no local mail. Have not connected for new mail. Have migrated before. Figured out how to use your new help system (complicated and not sure I am posting in the correct place). Have been working on this for about 10 days. Stumped. Missing some bits of knowledge. Have not downloaded any new mail. Would appreciate some help or advice. Thanks.
creator: Renders
